results.title: The Delights of Turkey
results.creator_credit: Greg Grainger and Grainger Television Australia
results.brief_description: Filmmaker Greg Grainger journeys for 4,000 km around Western Turkey on a motorcycle. Beginning in Istanbul, home of the more liberal Turkish Muslims, we visit famous tourist venues such as the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and the magnificent Grant Bazaar. Travelling along the coast, we see the increasing numbers of young Australians making their pilgrimage to Gallipoli at Anzac Cove. Remains of Roman civilization and architecture are evident throughout Western Turkey and Greg’s group rides in a hot air balloon over the strange cave houses of Cappadocia. Traditional farming and carpet making in rural areas are shown as happily co-existing with the more modern tourist attractions of restaurants, belly dancing and shopping in the cities.

results.title: FleshPool
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Julie Rrap
results.brief_description: Julie Rrap’s unconventional nude study uses digital imaging to stunning effect, creating a fleshy mutant form as a woman slides into her own reflection.

results.title: The Decline of Tsarism
results.creator_credit: Ian Thompson and University of Warwick
results.brief_description: Using archival footage, this program studies the military defeats and growing social unrest that resulted in the 1917 abdication of Tzar Nicholas II, ending the Romanov dynasty in Russia.
results.description: Using archival footage, this program studies the military defeats and growing social unrest that resulted in the 1917 abdication of Tzar Nicholas II, ending the Romanov dynasty in Russia.
description_for_label: Using archival footage, this program studies the military defeats and growing social unrest that resulted in the 1917 abdication of Tzar Nicholas II, ending the Romanov dynasty in Russia.

results.title: The Dame Was Loaded for DOS
results.creator_credit: Philips Interactive Media, Inc. and Beam Software
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. Two CD-ROM, CD case insert and manual in 2 CD capacity jewel case
results.brief_description:
A hardboiled detective, femme Fatales, missing people and money. The Dame was Loaded has all the hardboiled elements of film noir and is just as cinematic.

Created using innovative Full Motion Video (FMV) technology, which was developed in-house at Beam Software, this point-and-click adventure incorporated real footage of actors that players interact with to solve the mystery. At the time when computer graphics were limited, PMV games tried to generate empathy in players by putting them in the protagonist’s point of view and presenting other characters as real people in a fully realised game world.

When it was made it was the largest multimedia production in Australia, with game developers collaborating closely with actors and film crews, who used iconic Melbourne landmarks as settings like the art-deco former police headquarters on Russell Street.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philips Interactive Media, Inc. and Beam Software
